title: Sixteen years from now a​ girl's age will be 3 times her present age. What is the​ girl's age now? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us call the girl's age (in years) X. In sixteen years from now, the girl's age will be X + 16. At that time, her age will also be 3 times her present age, so it will be 3 * X. Since her age at that time will be 3 * X and X + 16, one may write : 3 * X = X + 16 Or : 2 * X = 16 Or : X = 8 The girl's age is 8 now.

This can be answered using a simple Linear equation. Let the variable representing the girl’s present age be defined as ‘x’ In 16 years, the girls age will be ‘x+16’ In 16 years she will be 3 times as old as her present age and so x + 16 is equal to 3 times her present age or ‘3x’ So writing this mathematically: x+16=3x Then Solve x + 16 = 3x 16 = 3x - x 16 = 2x 16/2 = x 8 = x x = 8. Because x represents the present age of the girl, the girl’s age now is 8 years old.
